{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header|cwchar}}
{{dcl|
const wchar_t* wcschr( const wchar_t* str, wchar_t ch );
}}
{{dcl|1=
      wchar_t* wcschr(       wchar_t* str, wchar_t ch );
}}
{{dcl end}}

Finds the first occurrence of the wide character {{c|ch}} in the wide string pointed to by {{c|str}}. 

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|str|pointer to the null-terminated wide string to be analyzed}}
{{par|ch|wide character to search for}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Pointer to the found character in {{c|str}}, or a null pointer if no such character is found.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cwchar&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;locale&gt;

int main()
{
    const wchar_t arr[] = L"白猫 黒猫 кошки";
    const wchar_t* cat = std::wcschr(arr, L'猫');
    const wchar_t* dog = std::wcschr(arr, L'犬');

    std::cout.imbue(std::locale("en_US.utf8"));

    if (cat)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "The character 猫 found at position " &lt;&lt; cat - arr &lt;&lt; '\n';
    else
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "The character 猫 not found\n";

    if (dog)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "The character 犬 found at position " &lt;&lt; dog - arr &lt;&lt; '\n';
    else
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "The character 犬 not found\n";
}
|output=
The character 猫 found at position 1
The character 犬 not found
}}
